meanings.definition: Comparative form of blot: having more blot.
meanings.sent1: The blottier paper absorbed all the ink quickly.
meanings.sent2: Her blottier hands showed she had been working hard.
meanings.sent3: The blottier cat left paw prints all over the clean floor.
meanings.sent4: The blottier sky was filled with dark storm clouds.
meanings.sent5: The blottier sponge soaked up the spilled water in seconds.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of blot: covered in more blot.
meanings.sent1: The blottier tablecloth was stained with spaghetti sauce.
meanings.sent2: His blottier shirt had ink marks all over it.
meanings.sent3: The blottier book looked like it had been used as a coaster.
meanings.sent4: The blottier carpet was a patchwork of spilled drinks.
meanings.sent5: The blottier painting was ruined by accidental smudges.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of blot: characterized by more blot.
meanings.sent1: The blottier novel had many plot holes and inconsistencies.
meanings.sent2: His blottier speech was filled with mistakes and stutters.
meanings.sent3: The blottier movie script was a mess of crossed-out lines.
meanings.sent4: The blottier reputation of the company led to decreased sales.
meanings.sent5: The blottier drawing was marred by accidental pen marks.
